posts.post_content:
I will be bringing the following this year: Just a selection. If you are coming to this year's National, be aware that MItch and I can only help one person each at a time. We will not violate that policy so please be patient if we are busy.

I will be bringing a selection of all Tobacco cards, probably 600+ baseball, all ungraded. I will be selling them at 20% off my prices, and if you buy enough even more off of that. Probably 300to 400 T206s.

Stop by at Booth 305P.

Steve_NY
Maybe you and Mitch ought to hire another body.........and then learn a little tact.

Sorry, but if you don't like our policy, don't buy from us. I was being courteous, and didn't want to insult anyone. I guess you want me to hand you a box of T206's so you could look through them at your leisure while I help someone else; cards that range from $50 to Thousands of dollars each would be in that one box. The only way to maintain security is to operate like a jewelry store; one customer per person at a time. We will get to everyone.

I am being as tactful as I can so forgive me if anyone is insulted. 

Just ask around the National dealers and you will discover that there were some incredible "missing" items last year; they all developed legs. 

To be entirely honest, I would rather lose a sale than compromise my security. You must understand that. If not, such is life.
I could be out of line myself but don't believe that a B/S/T section of any board is meant for your type of post. I'm over it....just a thought.

[quote name="Steve_NY" post=1300691]Sorry, but if you don't like our policy, don't buy from us. I was being courteous, and didn't want to insult anyone. I guess you want me to hand you a box of T206's so you could look through them at your leisure while I help someone else; cards that range from $50 to Thousands of dollars each would be in that one box. The only way to maintain security is to operate like a jewelry store; one customer per person at a time. We will get to everyone.

I am being as tactful as I can so forgive me if anyone is insulted. 

Just ask around the National dealers and you will discover that there were some incredible "missing" items last year; they all developed legs. 

To be entirely honest, I would rather lose a sale than compromise my security. You must understand that. If not, such is life.[/QUOTE]

These BST sections are not for blatant, over-advertising of your National stuff. Please don't post anymore in these sections until after the National. Thanks....PM sent with the same message.. thanks
Thanks for setting me straight. I will not post any more items I am selling at the National since that is not permitted.

[quote name="Steve_NY" post=1301043]Thanks for setting me straight. I will not post any more items I am selling at the National since that is not permitted.[/QUOTE]

 The idea of our BST is to sell stuff on this board not advertise it for sale other places. I don't usually say anything if someone does it once ....and then maybe again later. When I looked at your threads started it seemed a bit overzealous to me. There is one section that is for ebay and other auctions.....that would be the only place to really post your national stuff. Had you asked I would have told you....nothing personal and good luck with everything....LL

of course if you are only responding to a question from a member you can still do that....and btw, you should post on the main forum and join in the reindeer games there too....there is always a little more leniency on board matters given to frequent site posters.....if you help the site it can help you....

Leon -- I hear you. BTW the reason I didn't ask where I could post was because I didn't want to overstay my welcome.  Once read the rules, I am perfectly happy to abide by them. Stop by and say hello. Steve

[quote name="Steve_NY" post=1301322]Leon -- I hear you. BTW the reason I didn't ask where I could post was because I didn't want to overstay my welcome.  Once read the rules, I am perfectly happy to abide by them. Stop by and say hello. Steve[/QUOTE]

will do Steve.....

posts.post_title: I agree with Steve although what's his last name?
posts.post_content:
I had EXPENSIVE t206's stolen from me when I set up a couple of yrs ago for the same reason he mentioned--tried to help several at one time and handed a bunch to one person;  one of whom frequents and posts here --not a lot lately though-- and I believe he was one of 2 people who possibly lifted them---the other person bought $4000 worth and this person looked through 100 cards or so and didn't buy one.

I do think he could have been more tactful whether he should have posted here or not

Lastly, the one thing I don't like about emails is you can't tell the person's tone of voice; had he said it to us where you could hear his voice it may not have come across as it did.....
cheers Bill Latzko
